issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
When looking at my browser history, I see a lot of "Eucalyptus Management Console". It's hard to know how to use the history to get back to a specific page or resource. Adding information about resource and id when appropriate would make this much more useful.
i.e. "Eucalyptus Management Console : Stacks : console-at-scale"
fields.summary: Include some page information in title for better browser history.

comments.body: YESPLZ

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1693

I've attached a screen shot showing my browser history for initial review, but feel free to run the branch!

[~dkavanagh]: I think we need a better approach than parsing the URL for the title, since URL components are not very readable IMO.  For example, we can do better than "Eucalyptus Management Console : elbs : kg-elb1/monitoring" for the ELB monitoring page title.

I suggest we create a "page_title" slot in master_layout that we can fill in the respective templates.  For example, the ELB monitoring page would fill that page_title slot to create a readable title such as "Eucalyptus Management Console : Load Balancers : kg-elb1 : monitoring"

Thoughts?

/cc [~jloza]
Yes, I like the second, formatted approach better, please. Kicking ticket back. Thanks, y'all!

I tried to be very economical with code (which I think I achieved), but I realized that non-pretty names could be an issue.

I'm trying to figure out how to keep the title predictable, not accidentally consistent. That means, not having each page define ": foo : bar", rather ["foo", "bar"] and that gets formatted consistently.

This ought to look tons better.

in the code, sorry about all the pep-8 cleanup.. it's good, but it makes it a little harder to tell what's related this fix. Searching for title_parts in the diff will help a lot.
Looks great, [~dkavanagh]! One small thing: I noticed some words do not have spaces between, can you fix that to make them more human readable, please? Such as KeyPairs should be Key Pairs etc...
added in elbs, keypairs, launchconfigs, scalinggroups and securitygroups (as well as manage credentials page).
Looks great, except dashboard doesn't seem to say dashboard. Just says Eucalyptus Management Console...
well, our dashboard is the default page. If you want me to add "Dashboard", I will.
yesplz
done!

Looking good, [~dkavanagh]! Thanks!

UX review passed, ready for code review.
[~dkavanagh]: We'll need to resolve merge conflicts in PR 1693.  Feel free to punt it back to me for review after resolving those conflicts.
[~dkavanagh]: Hmm, PR 1693 still has merge conflicts.
sorry, didn't see that other merge into master.
PR 1693 merged.  [~dkavanagh]: Could you list the pages that now have improved title meta tags to help QA verify this ticket?
From what I remember, All the pages.
Verified. Browser(safari)'s history list shows the specific resource types and names.
